intro: Psychotria sarmentosa var. pachyphylla, commonly known as the thick-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, often hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or liana, often found in humid, shaded environments. Its thick leaves are adapted to retain moisture, making it well-suited for its native habitat.
